Hotels.nl › Groningen hotels › Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre

Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre

Three stars hotel 100%of guests recommend Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre

Radesingel 50, Groningen Map 0.7 km (City centre, within walking distance of the Central Station.)

Book now

Score of 46 reviews: 8.2

Beste hotel van Groningen 2016
  Show large photos

The hospitable Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre lies just within the canal ring of Groningen, in a quiet location by the Oosterhaven. The hotel has a lift, a laundry service and it is possible to hire a bike at reception so that you can explore the city and its surroundings. You will quickly feel at home upon arrival at this hotel, thanks to the friendly and attentive staff.

If you're looking for a good night's rest, then this is the hotel for you, as it lies just outside Groningen's renowned nightlife area. The hotel rooms are spacious and come with excellent beds, plus it is also possible to open a window. There is a refreshing bathroom with a shower and toilet. You can head to Grand Café, the hotel's special breakfast area for a cup of tea or coffee. There is also a library, where guests regularly come to quietly read a newspaper or a book.

The hotel also has three fully furnished apartments situated directly opposite the main entrance. The apartments feature a living room and a kitchen and are suitable for up to 4 persons. Guests staying here are able to make use of the hotel's facilities including the bar, breakfast service or tea or coffee. It is also possible to park in the car park situated underneath the hotel or at a reduced rate in a nearby public car park.

8.2
Score of 46 reviews Show all reviews
“ Hotel has own parking. vEry close to the centre. Breakfast is good. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. Can recommend the hotel. ” Ronny Boer November 22, 2017

Surroundings

Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre lies close to nice restaurants and cafes. The Kattendiep is certainly worth visiting. Opposite the Casino are various restaurants serving international cuisine, and the pleasant pavement cafes are teeming during warm weather. The romantic Via Vecchia alley harbours surprising little restaurants such as Boccaccio, Cervantes and Hemingway's Cuba.Cultural Groningen has three large theatres, the Stadsschouwburg, the Grand Theatre and the Oosterpoort, all in and around the centre. Going out can be enjoyed into the early hours: the pubs and clubs of Groningen are open until very late. It is easy to get everywhere by bike, and Groningen is a very bicycle friendly city.

Food & Drink

An extensive international breakfast buffet is available at the Grand Café, Monday to Friday from 07:00 until 10:00, and at weekends from 08:00 until 11:00. The surrounding area offers a great choice of restaurants.

Details

Chains
Hampshire Hotels
Check-in
from 15:00
Check-out
until 12:00
Number of rooms
77
Wi-Fi
FREE! Guests can make free use of wireless internet at the hotel.
Car park
Guests can use parking of the hotel for €17 per night, depending on availbility. Or use the public parking garage Q-park Rademarkt within walking distance of the hotel. At the reception you can purchase a day ticket at a discount.
Children/extra beds
One child up to 3 years can stay in the room with the parents free of charge. A cot can be placed on request for €15 a night. More information regarding larger amounts of children can be acquired at the hotel.
Internet
You can make free use of wireless Internet at the hotel. There is also an Internet corner in the lobby.
Smoking policy
The entire hotel is non-smoking.
Pets
Not allowed.
Facilities
24-hour reception, Bar, Breakfast, Computer (public), Drinks Vending Machine/Items can be purchased at Reception, Electric bike charging point, Electric car charging point, Green Key certificate, Gym, Laundry, Lift, Luggage storage, Shoe polish machine/ Shoe polish set, Snacks Vending Machine/Items can be purchased at Reception, Free WiFi. On request: Dry Cleaners, Fax/Copy machine, Meeting/Function Room, Microwave, Packed Lunch.

Important information

Attention! The payment for your stay should either be settled upon arrival at the hotel or via iDEAL to Hotels.nl. Invoices will not be dispatched.

8.4
  • Ronny Boer (Older couples)
  • November 22, 2017
Weekend in Groningen
  • + Hotel has own parking. vEry close to the centre. Breakfast is good. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. Can recommend the hotel.
  • – We had a partially blocked drain in shower, one attempt was made to fix, but did not work. The offered to fix it again, but it was our last morning. The hair dryer installed in the bathroom was not working properly. I was given a new handheld one to use. It is still a student city, and you wake up several times due to noisy persons passing by. It might be better to be on the 7th floor than on the first.
7.8
  • Ian Finlay (Older couples)
  • August 30, 2017
5 minutes walk from the activities in the busy city centre
  • + In a quiet position just minutes away from the, student filled, city centre.
  • – Renovation work being carried out - but this added to the lower price
  • * my tip Get a discount 24 hour parking voucher when you check out at reception and just park in the local multi storey car parks ( choice of 2 only minutes away )
10.0

Comfortable clean central hotel

Great location, excellent service, secure bike parking
  • + Friendly staff, lovely breakfast, clean room and a really comfy bed. It was also great to be able to lock bikes securely in the basement car park. It was also great value.
  • – It s a busy area and the room was noisy with the windows open. Closing them meant it became very hot.
  • * my tip Stay in the back of the hotel (north facing). Parking at the hotel - like anywhere in Groningen - is expensive. We parked our car for free in a suburb and cycled into the city.
9.2

  • * my tip http www.houdtvaneten.nl , excellent restaurant

Good hotel for price paid,but need to improve on providi
  • + The friendliness of the staff.Hot drinks available 24 7. Good selection of food at Breakfast timeAsk
  • – Only small towels available for showering and only one pillow supplied per bed. The duvets on the single beds were to small also Not a good water flow in shower.
  • * my tip Ask for extra towels.

hôtel city

Excellent value, nice breakfast, nice location, very friendly staff.

8.8
  • S. Charisopoulos (Travelling alone)
best value for money
  • + hospitality, good breakfast, friendly personnel
  • * my tip maybe a mini bar in the room
8.0
  • P Gomes (Older couples)
  • + Excellent location, at walking distance from the center and the railway station. Great view over the city and or the canal, at least from the upper floors. Spacious, confortable room. Excellent, abundant breakfast (extra), well worth the additional 15 euros free cofee and tea available from an automatic machine 24h a day.
  • – Room lighting could be better. Too few clothes hangers in the closet and none outside it.
  • * my tip Take the walking tour recommended by the tourist information center. You ll visit most of the interesting places in thecity. Don t forget to climb the Martini tower, whre you can even ring the bells. The Hema store near the center has an excellent cafeteria where you can inexpensively eat and or drink something (non-alcoholic).
7.2
  • Willem Dinkelman (Other)
Personeel en accomodatie
  • + Kamer en badkamer. En ligging hotel.
  • – Toen we aankwamen was het personeel erg met zichzelf bezig. Zien en reageren niet als er iemand binnen komt. In de ochtend was het al veel beter. Ontbijt is goed maar sober. Ook de accommodatie en aankleding is verouderd.
  • * my tip Tja, lees boven.

  • Eulalia Tatche (Travelling alone)
  • – The bathroom cleaning

Great for a city trip....

  • – The carpets in the room were not cleaned to the edges and this gave the impression that the room was unclean. Also I ordered a double bed and we got 2 very obvious singles pushed together which separated continuously
7.8
  • Vinther (Families with older children)
  • + Excellent breakfast
  • – The staff was able to make 2 mistakes on our invoice at departure. The hotel offers parking at a fee but requires that the guests have to leave their carkeys at the reception. The day of our departure we found out that they hadn't registered our key under the correct name which indeed was very unprofessional and caused us some problems and delayed our departure - not good enough!
  • * my tip Excellent breakfast. Nice situated in the center of the city. Very cramped carpark in the hotels cellar and on our stay problems keeping track on our carkey (misplaced it and stored it under a wrong name).
8.2

Good place to stay for business and visiting Groningen

El hotel dispone de internet y Wifi gratis, y cafe e infusiones durante todo el día por cortesia del hotel.

2013 dutch ice speedway weekend

Great time in Groningen

8.0
  • Sorgente (Older couples)
If you want or need to go to Groningen don't miss Hampshire Hotel
  • + Staff of the Hotel very kind and willing to help. Very nice room Very good facilities Excellent position of the premises
  • – Nothing
  • * my tip Very close to a lot of nice restaurants. We recommend to book in advance because without a reservation is not so easy to find a table free
6.4
  • de Sousa (Friends)
Great location and large, clean rooms but slightly expensive.
  • + The room and the bathroom were a good size and the bathroom was very clean. I appreciated the self-service (free) tea and coffee in the dining room upon arrival. The receptionist kindly arranged a taxi for us. The decor was nice in the room and in the lobby. Excellent location: close to the centre and to the station but in a quiet and pleasant street.
  • – The carpet was a little stained in the room. One of the receptionists was not so friendly when we arrived but the others were very nice. A little expensive for the off-season.
4.6
  • Katy (Travelling alone)
Basic hotel missing essentials for a comfortable stay
  • + God location nice bathrooms comfortable mattresses
  • – No mini bar or tea and coffee facilities or iron in rooms Awful pillows Extremely load noises of drilling etc for hotel renovations between 6 and 8.30pm No dinner at restaurant Poor breakfast No clocks in rooms
7.2
  • Chew (Other)
Pleasant stay
  • + Not too far from the city centre
  • – The bathroom was not too clean with the shower drain blocked. The heater coils was a little dusty/dirty so placing the towel there was not possible without cleaning it thoroughly.
9.6
  • EGS (Older couples)
Comfort and a little affordable luxury
  • + We stayed in a deluxe room on the 3rd floor and found it very spacious, comfortable and clean. We loved the view and were thrilled to find a huge bathtub in addition to the standalone shower. The bed was also very comfortable - we were sorry to leave!
  • * my tip The bar across the street, Café Peter Pan, has wonderful food and a nice atmosphere.
8.8
  • Elisabeth (Older couples)
very good
  • + location, parking, staff.......
  • – there is no shelve in the shower box for soaps, shampoos, etc.....
  • * my tip I enjoyed my stay there....
8.4

Good option got a fair price.
  • + I found the hotel service friendly. Rooms are clean. Good experience.
8.4
  • Jakub (Travelling alone)
Good for business travel. Nice location for reasonable price.
  • + Nice and "strategic" location, comfortable rooms for reasonable price. Free internet, parking at the hotel, helpful staff.
8.2
  • Anna-Mari (Friends)
It was like living in Groningen (separate apt)
  • + The separate apartment (for four) was fun and handy. We enjoyed the stay.
  • – No cleaning (three days). Did not bother us except for the trash.

Great location - shame about the coffee!
  • + Great location very close to the centre. Friendly staff.
  • – Breakfast - the only coffee and tea available comes from a machine which tastes awful. This was a real let down given that we'd paid 16 Euros for breakfast over 3 mornings. Would be OK to stay there and just get breakfast and coffee elsewhere though.
  • * my tip Don't include breakfast when booking.

not right in the center, but pretty close

Great value hotel, highly recommended. Will come back !

Business oriented / family unfriendly / good location

Nice hotel, good location, will come again

Reasonable price, helpful staff, great location

  • – better to be in the hotel looking out rather than the other way round as building is an eyesore. we made the mistake of hiring bikes from the hotel for the day, but discovered in the evening that the lights didn't work making for a hairy ride home.
9.8

Good for Groningen weekend!
  • + Location, friendly helpful staff. We received a city map with recommended restaurants with different accents (atmosphere, quality, hip) and things to do/see (shopping streets, towers, typical Groningen sights). Car can be parked in garage under hotel outside of daily work hours.
  • – Breakfast had hot and cold offerings but was good but a little on the simple side.
10.0
  • Fernanda Maria Bulcao Portela (Travelling alone)
Outstanding!
  • + The service is excellent and the staff very are very friendly. The location could not be better.
6.8
  • Graham Harris (Friends)
Good location, Reasonable room, slightly overpriced.
9.0
  • Judit Gyüre (Groups)
  • + Nice crew!
  • – We have to ay for services in advance (when we arrived), which is unsual.
8.0
  • janet richards (Older couples)
central and convenient
10.0
  • (Older couples)
Wonderful stay on a quiet street.
  • + We were booked into a different room but upon arrival discovered that the room was very hot, south facing and had no air conditioning. The hotel desk staff upgraded us to this very large luxury room for only 10 euros a night, so we were very pleased. We were on the top floor overlooking the canal so the view was wonderful. The complimentary coffee/tea in the mornings was also lovely as we could go down at any time and enjoy it, as well as the hotel computer that was nearby.
  • – None!
9.0
  • Vitaly Zviagin (Young couples)
Great rooms, very good location and view, definitely come again.
  • + Very nice rooms, small, but nice with a tv with english channels, separate beds, but manageable, snack machine at the elevator. Awesome view from the rooms, and free inet.
  • – none

  • Alan Willis (Travelling alone)
Great hotel at great price

  • – Charge for parking.

Going out can be enjoyed into the early hours: the pubs and clubs of Groningen are open until very late. It is easy to get everywhere by bike, and Groningen is a very bicycle friendly city. Food & Drink An extensive international breakfast buffet is available at the Grand Café, Monday to Friday from 07:00 until 10:00, and at weekends from 08:00 until 11:00. The surrounding area offers a great choice of restaurants. Details Chains Hampshire Hotels Check-in from 15:00 Check-out until 12:00 Number of rooms 77 Wi-Fi FREE! Guests can make free use of wireless internet at the hotel. Car park Guests can use parking of the hotel for €17 per night, depending on availbility. Or use the public parking garage Q-park Rademarkt within walking distance of the hotel. At the reception you can purchase a day ticket at a discount. Children/extra beds One child up to 3 years can stay in the room with the parents free of charge. A cot can be placed on request for €15 a night. More information regarding larger amounts of children can be acquired at the hotel. Internet You can make free use of wireless Internet at the hotel. There is also an Internet corner in the lobby. Smoking policy The entire hotel is non-smoking. Pets Not allowed. Facilities 24-hour reception, Bar, Breakfast, Computer (public), Drinks Vending Machine/Items can be purchased at Reception, Electric bike charging point, Electric car charging point, Green Key certificate, Gym, Laundry, Lift, Luggage storage, Shoe polish machine/ Shoe polish set, Snacks Vending Machine/Items can be purchased at Reception, Free WiFi. On request: Dry Cleaners, Fax/Copy machine, Meeting/Function Room, Microwave, Packed Lunch. Important information Attention! The payment for your stay should either be settled upon arrival at the hotel or via iDEAL to Hotels.nl. Invoices will not be dispatched. Your benefits at Hotels.nl Best price guaranteed The same room cheaper elsewhere? Money back! Show more No hidden costs Transparent prices and clear cancellation policy. Show more Pay at the hotel Possible at most hotels Show more Reviews Book now All reviews are completed by our guests after their stay at the hotel Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre. 8.4 Ronny Boer (Older couples) November 22, 2017 Weekend in Groningen + Hotel has own parking. vEry close to the centre. Breakfast is good. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. Can recommend the hotel. – We had a partially blocked drain in shower, one attempt was made to fix, but did not work. The offered to fix it again, but it was our last morning. The hair dryer installed in the bathroom was not working properly. I was given a new handheld one to use. It is still a student city, and you wake up several times due to noisy persons passing by. It might be better to be on the 7th floor than on the first. 7.8 Ian Finlay (Older couples) August 30, 2017 5 minutes walk from the activities in the busy city centre + In a quiet position just minutes away from the, student filled, city centre. – Renovation work being carried out - but this added to the lower price * my tip Get a discount 24 hour parking voucher when you check out at reception and just park in the local multi storey car parks ( choice of 2 only minutes away ) 10.0 Robert Simeone (Travelling alone) Comfortable clean central hotel + Excellent staff housekeeping and breakfast v 9.2 Simon Hewitt (Young couples) Great location, excellent service, secure bike parking + Friendly staff, lovely breakfast, clean room and a really comfy bed. It was also great to be able to lock bikes securely in the basement car park. It was also great value. – It s a busy area and the room was noisy with the windows open. Closing them meant it became very hot. * my tip Stay in the back of the hotel (north facing). Parking at the hotel - like anywhere in Groningen - is expensive. We parked our car for free in a suburb and cycled into the city. 9.2 Masquelier Karine (Older couples) + Excellent location and very clean room and bathroom . Large bay window with nice city view * my tip http www.houdtvaneten.nl , excellent restaurant 7.4 Robin Magee (Older couples) Good hotel for price paid,but need to improve on providi + The friendliness of the staff.Hot drinks available 24 7. Good selection of food at Breakfast timeAsk – Only small towels available for showering and only one pillow supplied per bed. The duvets on the single beds were to small also Not a good water flow in shower. * my tip Ask for extra towels. 8.0 JCR (Travelling alone) hôtel city + Good hôtel near Center breakfast is OK View town un room – Small room 10.0 Krzysztof Debski (Older couples) Krzysiek, Warszawa, Polska -- pobyt 4 dniowy zwiedzanie + czysto, schludnie, obs uga bardzo uprzejma i wyrozumia a, niadanie w odpowiednich porach. * my tip Bardzo dobry hotel w centrum miasta, komunikacja pociagi oraz autobusy blisko , godny polecenia do zwiedzania i odpoczynku. niadania w odpowiednich porach 7.00 -- 10.00 i b. smaczne 8.8 Caroline (Friends) Good stay + location, very early breakfast – not even a good morning for the people working at the breakfast * my tip the higher the best view 9.0 Nico van der Kamp (Young couples) Excellent value, nice breakfast, nice location, very friendly staff. + We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The location is ok, but inside it s very nice and all new interior. Clean, quiet and very nice breakfast which was included, so fantastic value. 8.8 S. Charisopoulos (Travelling alone) best value for money + hospitality, good breakfast, friendly personnel * my tip maybe a mini bar in the room 8.0 P Gomes (Older couples) + Excellent location, at walking distance from the center and the railway station. Great view over the city and or the canal, at least from the upper floors. Spacious, confortable room. Excellent, abundant breakfast (extra), well worth the additional 15 euros free cofee and tea available from an automatic machine 24h a day. – Room lighting could be better. Too few clothes hangers in the closet and none outside it. * my tip Take the walking tour recommended by the tourist information center. You ll visit most of the interesting places in thecity. Don t forget to climb the Martini tower, whre you can even ring the bells. The Hema store near the center has an excellent cafeteria where you can inexpensively eat and or drink something (non-alcoholic). 7.2 Willem Dinkelman (Other) Personeel en accomodatie + Kamer en badkamer. En ligging hotel. – Toen we aankwamen was het personeel erg met zichzelf bezig. Zien en reageren niet als er iemand binnen komt. In de ochtend was het al veel beter. Ontbijt is goed maar sober. Ook de accommodatie en aankleding is verouderd. * my tip Tja, lees boven. 7.2 Eulalia Tatche (Travelling alone) – The bathroom cleaning 8.6 M R N Bakels Instrella (Older couples) Great for a city trip.... + Excellent location, breakfast w variety, good choices. – Matras , te zacht voor iemand met rug probleem. Car park was full... Had to park in the neighborhood, was expensive. 7.2 N.N. (Travelling alone) + Price quality Contemporary building – Cold room on the first day 5.8 C I Bennett (Young couples) – The carpets in the room were not cleaned to the edges and this gave the impression that the room was unclean. Also I ordered a double bed and we got 2 very obvious singles pushed together which separated continuously 7.8 Vinther (Families with older children) + Excellent breakfast – The staff was able to make 2 mistakes on our invoice at departure. The hotel offers parking at a fee but requires that the guests have to leave their carkeys at the reception. The day of our departure we found out that they hadn't registered our key under the correct name which indeed was very unprofessional and caused us some problems and delayed our departure - not good enough! * my tip Excellent breakfast. Nice situated in the center of the city. Very cramped carpark in the hotels cellar and on our stay problems keeping track on our carkey (misplaced it and stored it under a wrong name). 8.2 Müller (Travelling alone) Good place to stay for business and visiting Groningen + Very good rooms with big windows. The breakfast is o.k. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. It is ideal for business travellers 9.2 Anónimo (Other) Muy buena estancia y un personal muy agradable + Hemos estado muy bien en el hotel, el personal es muy amable, esta bien ubicado cerca del centro, estación, restaurantes y tiendas, la habitación que estábamos tenía unas bonitas vistas al canal. El hotel dispone de internet y Wifi gratis, y cafe e infusiones durante todo el día por cortesia del hotel. * my tip Muy buena relación calidad precio, y personal muy amable. y bien ubicado. 9.4 Rowe (Other) Very well done Hampshire! + the staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful in all areas. Free coffee al the time was definately an added bonus, more hotels should do it. – Rooms could be a wee bit bigger, but only a small thing. * my tip All local coffee houses and restaurents in the area were very good, and always had somebody who spoke english! 7.8 isebia (Other) Comfort place with a friendly service!! + Location is near interesting places. – Room service: rearrangement of bed was poorly done. I needed to redo it myself. * my tip Nice and neat place close to the center!! 7.6 brooks (Older couples) 2013 dutch ice speedway weekend + free tea and coffee comfortable beds – price of breakfast * my tip ice speedway at assen 8.2 Anonymous (Families with older children) Great time in Groningen + Very friendly and helpful staff – Did not receive wake uP call 1 out of the 2 mornings requested Also, not really a negative but only breakfast buffet available for €15, would be nice to have a choice for a continental breakfast for say €5 ?? * my tip Climb martini tower 8.0 Sorgente (Older couples) If you want or need to go to Groningen don't miss Hampshire Hotel + Staff of the Hotel very kind and willing to help. Very nice room Very good facilities Excellent position of the premises – Nothing * my tip Very close to a lot of nice restaurants. We recommend to book in advance because without a reservation is not so easy to find a table free 6.4 de Sousa (Friends) Great location and large, clean rooms but slightly expensive. + The room and the bathroom were a good size and the bathroom was very clean. I appreciated the self-service (free) tea and coffee in the dining room upon arrival. The receptionist kindly arranged a taxi for us. The decor was nice in the room and in the lobby. Excellent location: close to the centre and to the station but in a quiet and pleasant street. – The carpet was a little stained in the room. One of the receptionists was not so friendly when we arrived but the others were very nice. A little expensive for the off-season. 4.6 Katy (Travelling alone) Basic hotel missing essentials for a comfortable stay + God location nice bathrooms comfortable mattresses – No mini bar or tea and coffee facilities or iron in rooms Awful pillows Extremely load noises of drilling etc for hotel renovations between 6 and 8.30pm No dinner at restaurant Poor breakfast No clocks in rooms 7.2 Chew (Other) Pleasant stay + Not too far from the city centre – The bathroom was not too clean with the shower drain blocked. The heater coils was a little dusty/dirty so placing the towel there was not possible without cleaning it thoroughly. 9.6 EGS (Older couples) Comfort and a little affordable luxury + We stayed in a deluxe room on the 3rd floor and found it very spacious, comfortable and clean. We loved the view and were thrilled to find a huge bathtub in addition to the standalone shower. The bed was also very comfortable - we were sorry to leave! * my tip The bar across the street, Café Peter Pan, has wonderful food and a nice atmosphere. 8.8 Elisabeth (Older couples) very good + location, parking, staff....... – there is no shelve in the shower box for soaps, shampoos, etc..... * my tip I enjoyed my stay there.... 8.4 AGG (Travelling alone) Good option got a fair price. + I found the hotel service friendly. Rooms are clean. Good experience. 8.4 Jakub (Travelling alone) Good for business travel. Nice location for reasonable price. + Nice and "strategic" location, comfortable rooms for reasonable price. Free internet, parking at the hotel, helpful staff. 8.2 Anna-Mari (Friends) It was like living in Groningen (separate apt) + The separate apartment (for four) was fun and handy. We enjoyed the stay. – No cleaning (three days). Did not bother us except for the trash. 6.4 Anonymous (Other) Great location - shame about the coffee! + Great location very close to the centre. Friendly staff. – Breakfast - the only coffee and tea available comes from a machine which tastes awful. This was a real let down given that we'd paid 16 Euros for breakfast over 3 mornings. Would be OK to stay there and just get breakfast and coffee elsewhere though. * my tip Don't include breakfast when booking. 8.2 Anonymous (Travelling alone) not right in the center, but pretty close + clean and friendly staff – not right in the center, but pretty close. Breakfast is pretty plain. 8.2 Anonymous (Travelling alone) Friendly staff, great location and comfortable rooms 9.8 Anonymous (Travelling alone) An excellent friendly and hospitable hotel in the right place + Very friendly and helpful staff, free wi-fi, an excellent and quiet location with very clean and comfortable rooms. Excellent value for money – None * my tip Enjoy your stay! 10.0 Paul Reason (Friends) Great value hotel, highly recommended. Will come back ! 7.0 Anonymous (Families with older children) Business oriented / family unfriendly / good location + Newly renovated. Clean – Unpersonalized receipt at Reception. Not a family hotel. Not enough light in the bathrooms. Lugage kept behind Reception Desk looks very unprofessional. Extra 15 euro p.p. for breakfast is a rip-off. 8.2 Anonymous (Families with young children) Nice hotel, good location, will come again + Very nice hotel, relatively close to railway station and to city centre (Grote Markt). Ideal for city trip – We had to pay on arrival, which in a hotel this standard is unusual. The beds (mattresses) were way too soft. 9.2 John Sharpe (Older couples) Reasonable price, helpful staff, great location + very helpful staff. a free upgrade to a room on the fifth floor with a wonderful view over the city. very good breakfast – better to be in the hotel looking out rather than the other way round as building is an eyesore. we made the mistake of hiring bikes from the hotel for the day, but discovered in the evening that the lights didn't work making for a hairy ride home. 9.8 Anonymous (Families with older children) Good for Groningen weekend! + Location, friendly helpful staff. We received a city map with recommended restaurants with different accents (atmosphere, quality, hip) and things to do/see (shopping streets, towers, typical Groningen sights). Car can be parked in garage under hotel outside of daily work hours. – Breakfast had hot and cold offerings but was good but a little on the simple side. 10.0 Fernanda Maria Bulcao Portela (Travelling alone) Outstanding! + The service is excellent and the staff very are very friendly. The location could not be better. 6.8 Graham Harris (Friends) Good location, Reasonable room, slightly overpriced. 9.0 Judit Gyüre (Groups) + Nice crew! – We have to ay for services in advance (when we arrived), which is unsual. 8.0 janet richards (Older couples) central and convenient 10.0 (Older couples) Wonderful stay on a quiet street. + We were booked into a different room but upon arrival discovered that the room was very hot, south facing and had no air conditioning. The hotel desk staff upgraded us to this very large luxury room for only 10 euros a night, so we were very pleased. We were on the top floor overlooking the canal so the view was wonderful. The complimentary coffee/tea in the mornings was also lovely as we could go down at any time and enjoy it, as well as the hotel computer that was nearby. – None! 9.0 Vitaly Zviagin (Young couples) Great rooms, very good location and view, definitely come again. + Very nice rooms, small, but nice with a tv with english channels, separate beds, but manageable, snack machine at the elevator. Awesome view from the rooms, and free inet. – none 8.8 Alan Willis (Travelling alone) Great hotel at great price + Excellent room for the price. Clean, bright, spacious and modern. A very enjoyable stay – Charge for parking. 6.4 Daniel (Travelling alone) Mr. + Good system for leaving the luggage during the day after checkout. i These are the most recent reviews. show on map stars Score: 8.1 | 0.2 km “ Your Staff do you real credit. digest: The modern Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre is located by the Oosterhaven in the city centre of Groningen. Several hotel rooms also offer a lovely view of the yachts and sailing boats. A 10-minute walk will take you to the lovely shopping area, while the vibrant Grote Markt, Groningen Central Station and the Groninger Museum are just a 15-minute walk away.
title: Hampshire Hotel Groningen Centre - The Netherlands on Hotels.nl
